Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a fish and label it correctly.
The student can draw and label the habitat where the fish lives, such as a lake, river, pond, or ocean.
The student can label the water in the fish's habitat, showing it as an essential resource for the fish.
The student can draw and label other components of the fish's environment, like plants or rocks, to show resources or objects found in the habitat.
The student can illustrate and label how the fish interacts with its environment, like swimming in water, to survive.
The student can show and label how different parts of the habitat work together to support the fish's needs, demonstrating the system of the habitat.
